power.name: Charge
power.text: Tilt your character card (to indicate it is charged). Draw a card.

power.name: Discharge
power.text: Un-tilt your character card. You may play a card.

ul.li: One player may play a card now.
Deal 2 lightning damage to a target
One player may search their trash for an Equipment card and put it in their hand.

card.name: Strength
card.text: Deal 3 melee damage to a target. If Battery is charged, deal 2 melee damage to the same target

quote.text: She went from fighting like an ordinary individual to moving at high speeds and throwing crushing punches, then back again.

card.name: Knock 'em Down
card.text: Deal 2 melee damage to a non-hero target. If Battery is charged, deal 2 melee damage to all non-hero targets

quote.text: She threw the table like an oversize frisbee, and I pushed Tattletale in one direction as I flung myself in the other. The table edge caught the weapon in Tattletale’s hands and knocked it from her grip with enough force to make Tattletale roll as she hit the ground.

card.name: Shock and Awe
card.text: Deal 2 lightning damage to a target. If Battery is charged, deal 3 lightning damage to up to 3 additional targets

card.name: Knockout Punch
card.text: Deal 2 lightning damage to a target. If Battery is charged, you deal damage in this way, and the target is not a character card, treat that target as if it had no card text until your next turn

quote.text: She didn’t bolt straight for us, though. Instead, she leaped to one side, kicked Assault square in the middle of the chest with both feet, and then careened off in the opposite direction.

card.name: Pushing the Limits
card.text: If Battery is charged, you may play 2 cards. If Battery is not charged, draw 3 cards.

quote.text: “I want to stop him. And not just him. I want to help things make sense again, even if it means playing unfair because they’re playing unfair. Crime should have consequences.”

card.name: ...then Pushing it Beyond
card.text: When you play this card, Battery deals herself 3 psychic damage. You may play a card. You may use a power.

quote.text: Whatever these favors were, all she could do was hope she could do enough good to counterbalance any wrongs she’d have to commit.

card.name: Pow!
card.text: Select a non-hero target. If Battery is charged and the target is not a character card, put it on top of its deck and then deal 3 melee damage to a non-hero target. Otherwise, deal 2 melee damage to that target

quote.text: Battery used up her charge and swept it aside before it could strike home and finish off the heroine.

card.name: Cool Toys
card.text: Deal X lightning damage to a target, where X = the number of equipment and device cards in play. If Battery is charged, you may destroy an equipment or device card

quote.text: “You have access to our channel,” Battery growled, interrupting Tattletale’s spiel of numbers.

card.name: Rapid Recon
card.text:
If Battery is not charged, all heroes may draw a card.
Draw a card. You may play a card

quote.text: “So I’m going by the book, and I’m walking away. But I’ll be keeping an eye on you, on this, and the moment you go too far, we’re coming after you, no holds barred.”

card.name: No Time to Rest
card.text: When you destroy a target, you may draw a card and you may play a card

quote.text: Armsmaster strode away from the Undersiders, and I saw Assault, Battery, Brandish, Night and Fog move to join that group, among others. Smaller than the first group, but I suppose it took a certain amount of bravery to be willing to get close to an Endbringer when you weren’t invincible or close to it.

card.name: Magnetism
card.power: If Battery is charged, destroy an equipment or device card. If Battery is not charged, choose an equipment card from a hero's trash and put it into play

quote.text: But she didn’t give him the opportunity to do either. Instead, she spent the rest of her accumulated power in a single burst, pulling at the metal of a nearby chair. It fell over, sliding into Madcap’s path.

card.name: Static Charge
card.text: At the start of your turn, if Battery has used her Discharge power since the start of your last turn, deal 2 lightning damage to all non-hero targets

quote.text: Between one heartbeat and the next, everything seemed to click. She felt as though she were floating in slow motion rather than falling, her body thrumming.

card.name: Glowing Threads
card.text: When Battery uses her Discharge power reduce damage dealt to her by 2 until the start of her next turn

quote.text: Battery was charging again, taking advantage of us being off balance to build up a store of power again. Heck, she’d probably built her whole fighting style around it. I could see the normally cobalt blue lines of her costume glowing a brilliant electric blue-white.
